content:
@Mark Kramer I'm hoping you can help me out with this ODH issue.

I've added into eCR IG a dependency to the newly published (yay!) ODH IG.

I have an example for PastOrPresentJob (http://hl7.org/fhir/us/odh/StructureDefinition-odh-PastOrPresentJob.html).

I get the following error: 

Could not match discriminator ([code.coding.code]) for slice Observation.component:odh-IsCurrentJob in profile http://hl7.org/fhir/us/odh/StructureDefinition/odh-PastOrPresentJob - the discriminator [code.coding.code] does not have fixed value, binding or existence assertions

I'm not actually including that slice in the example but it still fails.

I think the issue is that the odh-IsCurrentJob is missing a code binding and the slice is code.coding.code.
pasted image

If you agree, I'll raise a Jira for the issue and hopefully it can be corrected without too much trouble.

I'm thinking it won't be corrected in time for publication of eCR as we want to do that asap and were just waiting for ODH publication to move forward. Thinking we probably don't want an error in our IG so might end up removing the example that is causing the issue.
@Sarah Gaunt Shoot. I will look into it...
Hey @Mark Kramer - just wondering if you ever had a chance to look into this? I haven't raised a Jira for it - should I?
